<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Environment

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Synchronizes Simul Weather with Arma weather, generates all keyframes.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''simulWeatherSync'''

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[simulWeatherSync]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[forceWeatherChange]]
</value></part></template>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>New Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 4, 2016 - 22:24 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:AgentRevolution|AgentRev]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The behavior of this command is similar to [[forceWeatherChange]], however it leaves current weather transitions intact. Its main purpose would be to refresh the cloud cover to properly reflect current [[overcast]], as they can sometime get out of sync, especially when using [[setTimeMultiplier]] and [[setAccTime]].
</dd>
</dl>
